newsitem.title: UK: Physical zinc market seen wary after price spike.
newsitem.headline: Physical zinc market seen wary after price spike.

text.p: A few zinc consumers may jump in the physical market following Thursday's spike in futures prices to 4-1/2 year highs, but many are likely to be cautious, traders said.
"We might see a bit of panic buying when Europe returns next week," one said, referring to the Ascension Day holiday on Thursday that is expected to dampen business on Friday also.
Activity has been moderate in the physical market over the past couple of week after a bout of shortcovering in late March and could remain relatively slow as summer approaches, he added.
Fund buying pushed three months zinc $41 higher on Thursday morning to a peak $1,328 on the London Metal Exchange, the highest since October 1992.

Many physical buyers are likely to hold back, since several times they had been advised to buy on price spikes when prices later eased. "Consumers have burned their fingers before...they can be a bit cautious," a trader said.
Another trader said: "I think consumers will back off and there'll be selling into it."
Premiums were steady, with high grade duty-paid metal at $25/$35 above LME cash, cif Rotterdam, and CIS material at level to $5 above LME cash, unchanged over the past several weeks.
Good offtake has been seen from the steel industry, traders said.
"The steel sector was going through a destocking phase over the last six months. But now they will have to rebuild the stocks as well as take care of ongoing needs," one said.
The physical market may be slow through the summer, but should see a good second half, one trader said. "I have high hopes for the third and fourth quarters," a trader said.
